Entries.default: "Who dares disturb my sanctum?"
"You will pester me no more!"

A skeletal creature sprawls on a crumbling throne. It rises with a lurch and the grind of bone on bone.

Its clothing is ragged, unkempt. You find its movements strangely familiar. Its clothing shifts and reveals a patchwork of decaying skin.

"Imagine, if you are capable of such a thing, how uncanny it is to encounter you here, divided by great distance and the span of years.

"Do you come once again to disturb my exquisite labor of immortality?"
"What are you doing here?"
"Arkemyr suspected you'd still be poking around out here."
[Attack] "I've killed you once. I'll gladly do it again."
"I was one of the few of your 'menagerie' to escape Eothas' rise. As a result of your untimely - and entirely welcome - demise, I found myself free once again to continue my work."
"That hack may call himself an archmage, but he never had the spine to do what is required to transcend the limits of a mortal life."
"Now that I am free, I can make as many bodies as I need! I am no longer beholden to you." He spits the words like venom.

"I had lived many lifetimes in the Dyrwood and had learned all I could from it.

"There is much still unknown about the Deadfire. What secrets, what wisdoms might an ambitious archmage such as myself uncover?"
"Your foolish arrogance will be your end!"
"Like a troublesome child, you insist on meddling with forces beyond your petty comprehension. But it is no matter - I shall make another body as soon I am done with you."
[Put Concelhaut's skull in your pack.]
[Destroy the skull and eliminate Concelhaut for good.]
[Leave] "Looking forward to our next chat, Concelhaut. Always a pleasure."
You snatch Concelhaut's skull from the air and stuff it unceremoniously into your pack, cutting off his indignant screeches of protest.

"You wouldn't dare - !"

You throw Concelhaut's skull to the ground. His screeches reach a frenzied pitch as you raise your boot.
"Ah, so this is where my beloved pet has run off to."
"Acquiring a host body was simple enough. The Deadfire's residents are uneducated in the ways of sophisticated magics. They know not what - or whom - they should fear."
"You, and those like you, are a pox on Eora."
"A shame your taste in bodies lags behind your skill in acquiring them."
You smash his skull into dust, and his cries abruptly cease. The unearthly light of his eyes is extinguished.
The archmage Concelhaut is no more.

"He lacks the flame of inquiry that burns within all truly great wizards."

Concelhaut sniffs haughtily - a curiously kith-like affectation for an immortal creature who no longer has the need for breath.
A grimace stretches the thin skin across his mouth, revealing too many teeth and unsettling bits of jaw.
He speaks as a master might to an especially dim-witted student.
"Oh, I am all a-tingle with anticipation."
"And you think clinging to life in that moldering corpse makes you bold, is that it?"
"Or perhaps you think there's virtue in manipulating and terrorizing your apprentices?"
"You're nothing but a coward and a bully, Concelhaut. Afraid to die and afraid to be forgotten."
